articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Celtic have been heavily linked with a move for South Korea World Cup star Cho Gue-sung and now the player's father has had his say on his next transfer destination.
articles.title: Cho Gue-sung to Celtic: South Korea World Cup star's father has say on transfer destination

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Josip Juranovic took time out of Croatia’s celebrations following their World Cup win over Japan to console his Celtic team-mate Daizen Maeda on the pitch.
articles.title: Josip Juranovic reveals what he said to Celtic team-mate Daizen Maeda during emotional World Cup moment

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: There was always going to be particular fascination for followers of Scottish football’s big two as Croatia squared up to Japan in the World Cup last 16.
articles.title: Celtic and Rangers World Cup first this millennium as Croatia reach quarter-final with shoot-out win over Japan

articles.author: Angus Wright

articles.title: Celtic receive Gue-sung Cho signing boost as two clubs ruled out - but not the Scottish champions

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic star Kyogo Furuhashi will not allow missing out on the World Cup with Japan to have any detrimental effect on his scintillating form for the Scottish champions.
articles.title: Celtic star Kyogo Furuhashi reveals Celtic, Japan and goals ambition

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: On Sunday afternoon Olivier Giroud became France’s all-time top scorer with a goal in his country’s 3-1 win over Poland in the last-16 of the 2022 World Cup. It was his 52nd strike in 117 caps.
articles.title: When Celtic nearly signed Olivier Giroud, stuff of dreams, legendary stadium, phone call, Kilmarnock contempt

articles.author: Ross McLeish
articles.description: Celtic are expected to add further new players to their squad after confirming the arrival of Alistair Johnston over the weekend.
articles.title: Celtic likely to make further signing as trio linked on back of two new arrivals

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: In defying the odds, Australia spent their time in Qatar proving that team work, togetherness, solid preparation, pride, heart and endeavour can pepper holes in perceived limitations and help exceed expectations.
articles.title: Messi finds way to break down resilient Aussies as Hearts, Celtic, Dundee United and St Mirren stars return to clubs with heads held high

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic have confirmed the signing of Canada’s World Cup star Alistair Johnston from MLS side CF Montreal.
articles.title: Celtic sign Alistair Johnston - length of deal, when he will arrive, 'biggest clubs in the world'

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Lionel Messi. For some, the greatest of his generation. For others, the greatest to ever play the game. Millions, in Argentina and world wide, are willing him to win the greatest tournament of them all. The next stop on that quest in Qatar 2022 is the SPFL Select, sorry Australia.
articles.title: Australia v Argentina - Hearts star's value, Celtic and Dundee United duo impress, stopping Lionel Messi

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic have been backed to have a “plan already in place” if Giorgos Giakoumakis was to leave the club – and the Scottish champions have been linked with an in-form Dutch striker.
articles.title: 'Plan already in place' - Celtic linked with in-form ace as Postecoglou backed to replace Giorgos Giakoumakis

articles.description: Celtic’s stock is understandably at an all-time high in Japan.

articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou says he will deal with any issues as they arise with the happiness of his squad after reports this week that striker Giorgios Giakoumakis will look to leave the club in January after contract talks broke down.
articles.title: 'I'll deal with it': Ange Postecoglou has say on potential issues within squad amid Giorgos Giakoumakis speculation

Former Celtic striker Charlie Nicholas has blasted the return of Peter Lawwell to the club after it was announced that he would succeed Ian Bankier as Chairman. Alistair Johnston signed for Celtic at the weekend. The Canadian signed a five-year deal with the Hoops, moving from MLS side Montreal. The last time Celtic tried to dip into the American/Canadian market under Brendan Rodgers, the plan went horribly wrong. If you remember the names Andrew Gutman and Manny Perez, you’ll probably remember the […]

I will always be grateful to their team for giving me that opportunity. The most important article I wrote for them, and maybe the most important I have written or […]

articles.description:
Celtic forward Daizen Maeda has taken to social media after his World Cup heroics for Japan [@M_daizen_1020]. 初めてのW杯。これまで出会った方々、所属したチーム、家族、ファン、サポーター、沢山のサポートがあったからこそこの舞台に立てました。四年後。必ずリベンジします。沢山の応援本当にありがとうございました。これからも宜しくお願いします。#FIFAWorldCup pic.twitter.com/2PIxgE4GXU — 前田 大然 Daizen Maeda (@M_daizen_1020) December 6, 2022 The 25-year-old was a regular starter for his national team at the tournament and scored the opening goal in their Last 16 tie against Croatia.  His message […]

articles.title: Daizen Maeda Shares World Cup Social Media Message

articles.description: Former Celtic star Charlie Nicholas is concerned at what is happening at Celtic, believing the stall on new deals for key players could impact the future of Ange Postecoglou.  The Lowdown: Big players, little returns Amidst the current debacle on the contract front for key players like Josip Juranovic and Giorgos Giakoumakis, Nicholas feels both […]
articles.title: Charlie Nicholas alarmed by what he's hearing from Celtic, could force Ange to do a Rodgers

articles.description: Today, one of the worst kept secrets in Ibrox was confirmed to their fans; the era of directors funding the club out of their own pockets by trading cold hard cash for increasingly worthless shares is at an end. The next time a director puts his hand in his pockets to fund the mad fantasises […]
articles.title: An Ibrox Director Has Confirmed Their Fans Worst Fear About Continued Funding.

articles.description: The Mooch got a standing ovation today at the Ibrox AGM. He should have gotten two; one from the floor and the other from the board. He fulfilled his primary role quite brilliantly at that meeting; he gave the fans something to cheer and the board an easy ride. I’ll go into some detail for […]
articles.title: The Ibrox Board Gets An Easy Ride As “Stormy” AGM Turns Into A Love In For The Mooch.

articles.description: Celtic Historian David Potter each morning on The Celtic Star looks back at key Celtic events and matches on this day starting on  3rd December 1898. David’s latest book The Celtic Rising ~ 1965 The Year Jock Stein Changed Everything is very close to selling out on Celtic Star Books with just a few books remaining. Read More
articles.title: Celtic On This Day – 3rd December – David Potter’s Celtic Diary

articles.description:
Ange Postecoglou is delighted to get Yuki Kobayashi in the door at Celtic, believing the chance to sign him at the end of his contract was too good to turn down. Kobayashi is arriving as a free agent from Vissel Kobe, where he made 78 appearances in total at the heart of their defensive line. ...
The post Ange Postecoglou talks up Celtic bargain appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou talks up Celtic bargain

articles.description:
Ange Postecoglou refused to be drawn on reported Celtic interest in Alistair Johnston today but did reaffirm his intent to have the Bhoys in a stronger position at the end of January. Celtic have been widely reported to be on the brink of a move for Johnston in recent days, potentially becoming the club’s second ...
The post Ange Postecoglou swerves Alistair Johnston question but states exciting Celtic January intent appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou swerves Alistair Johnston question but states exciting Celtic January intent

articles.description: Founded in 1887 in the East End of Glasgow by founding father Brother Walfrid, Celtic is the biggest football clubs in the World and the only club from Scotland to win the European Cup, now the Champions League, to become Champions of Europe.The club is one of five across the globe to have won over Read More
articles.title: Best International Players to Play for Celtic this Century

articles.description: As my good friend Paddy Sinat over on Vital Celtic said earlier on today, and as others echoed in the past few hours, the club announced Peter Lawwell’s appointment as chairman in the most low key way possible. I noticed it when I saw the official club statement. When we announce a signing or an […]
articles.title: If The Lawwell Appointment Is Such A Good One, Why Are Celtic Low-Keying It?

articles.description:
Reo Hatate advised new Celtic signing Yuki Kobayashi to rest as much as possible prior to his big move to Scotland, having experienced fatigue after his switch last season. Kobayashi, like Daizen Maeda, Reo Hatate and Yosuke Ideguchi before him, are arriving in Glasgow after a long J-League season that is played over the summer ...
The post Reo Hatate's helpful advice for new Celtic signing appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Reo Hatate's helpful advice for new Celtic signing

articles.description:
Celtic are “very interested” in Dutch attacker Said Hamulic, TuttoMercatoWeb in Italy have reported this week. The outlet believes that clubs from France, Belgium, Italy and the Netherlands are tracking the progress of the versatile forward, who currently plays for Stal Mielic in the Polish top flight. But it’s said Celtic are showing the most ...
The post Report: Celtic showing serious interest in 9-goal Dutch attacker appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Report: Celtic showing serious interest in 9-goal Dutch attacker

articles.description: As the song goes ‘for a minute there, I lost myself’. I was under the impression Celtic had begun to modernise, had started to play catch-up with those football clubs who had taken advantage of our hitherto decade of inertia to embrace modern analytical processes and think outside the box in the recruitment of players, Read More
articles.title: The gaslighting of the Celtic support has returned alongside Peter Lawwell

articles.description:
Callum McGregor is “ready to go” and make an impact for Celtic once again, Ange Postecoglou confirmed today as the midfielder returned to full first-team squad training. McGregor travelled with the group to Sydney but looked to be taking part in non-contact training as he rehabilitated from the knee injury sustained against RB Leipzig on ...
The post Celtic hero returns to full first-team training after 2 month absence appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: Celtic hero returns to full first-team training after 2 month absence

articles.description: What a superb answer Ange gave today to the obvious question about the new boss at Ibrox. Beale is the new darling of the media, and this city can only really have one of those at a time. Ange will not give up that crown without a fight. Beale may have smarmed them, but Ange […]
articles.title: The Celtic Boss’s Michael Beale Slap-Down Was Deliciously, Devilishly Dismissive.

articles.description: An indication of just how far the Celtic Fan Media has developed over the last couple of years is the fact that the quite excellent Celtic Exchange podcast, yesterday managed to get an exclusive interview with former Celtic manager Martin O’Neill. We’ll cover this on The Celtic Star over the next few days starting this Read More
